attributes.action: Ensure that no funding from taxation is given to Political Parties, and that the current funding that is given to Political Parties is withdrawn.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I have no strong views on who should be able to donate how much to whatever
party. (Other than that the result of any donation or loan should not be a
seat in the House of Lords). I do however have very strong views on
political parties dipping their hands into my pockets to fund their
activities as their membership income is falling.

 I am a member of a political party, and  thus support it through my membership subscription. Conversely by subscribing to one party I am by definition withholding my money and approval from all other political parties. 

Political parties should realise that lack of income due to falling party 
membership is an indication that parties do not have general support. NOT 
an indication that taxpayers should have to support them. If political 
parties need more funding, then they need to appeal to a wider section of 
the general public, who might then take up membership.

I, and others, should not be compelled to support political parties, that I 
and others, by withholding membership and subscriptions indicate our 
disapproval of.
